name: Hilton Basingstoke

reviews.text: We were very disappointed with this hotel...it is more like a Day's Inn than a Hilton. No elevator so going up flights of stairs with heavy suitcases was not fun...though most people would not be bothered since this seems to be a businessman's hotel and thus luggage would normally be minimal. To be fair the receptionist did offer to help us...but really that is not his job. The 2nd floor was very squeaky so you could here every person who walked by. Free internet access in lobby but not in rooms...no way were we going to pay 15.00 pounds for this. Bar man in lobby really should not be in this job...not only does he never smile but he never looks up to see if there are any customers in the lobby who might like a drink, let alone a refill. The coffee shop/atrium; how sad it looks...the paint on all the chairs is chipped...some really badly..it can't cost that much to have them sprayed surely. The carpet and walls are a puce green. Staff are friendly and trying to do a good job but in need of lots of training..their lack of experience is very apparent. Parking is free so that is a plus. Reception was efficient. Rooms very small, tired looking and bed lumpy. Sorry but if the room rate was half the price, I would say I got what I paid for.
reviews.title: Not your typical Hilton

reviews.text: First impressions of the hotel were good, plenty of free parking and helpful reception staff. I was upgraded to a deluxe room which seemed to have been recently updated and was in good condition. The major issue was with the shower which even though it was fitted with a thermostat kept changing from cold to extremely hot. Outside the room the floor was squeaky and being at the stair end of the hall made it noisy each time somebody walked past.
reviews.title: Bit expensive for what you get

reviews.text: Dinner at the restaurant was slow and after a long wait my main arrived before my starter. This was taken back and the starter then arrived followed quickly by the main but the overall time spent was over an hour for two courses. Had a free beer to make up for it but after a long days travel I would have settled for better service.
reviews.title: Excellent Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was okay for the money but the staff again seemed to be very forgetful and took several attempts to bring me my tea.
reviews.title: Not very good and expensive

reviews.text: Having just held an 80th Birthday party as well as two wedding receptions at the Hilton this year we found the service and attention to detail to be excellent. Staff at the hotel are some of the best we have come accross when responding to any request. Would thoroughly recomend either staying or holding any form of event at the Hilton Basingstoke.
reviews.title: Value for money if pre-book on the internet and don't have breakfast!!

reviews.text: It could be the only place you could find a slugish internet network in the UK. The wifi internet is very slow and there is no progress i have seen during my stay of 4 weeks. The rooms do not have AC so during warm days, I was sleeping with open window and running the small fan over my head. Thanks to God, those warm days were not much. Not recommonded if you are traveling for summary stay.
reviews.title: Intenet is very slow

reviews.text: Fantastic value for money,with first class facilities,reception/bar area very comfortable and rooms very clean and modern.Dont hesitate to book.We have stay in other hotels in the area in the past,but this was by far the best
reviews.title: great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted somewhere to stay on our back from Southampton Boat Show without going to far off the motorway.We booked a deluxe plus room on the internet for £66,which we felt was good value as it also included buffet breakfast.The hotel and room was spacious,however we did feel the tiles over the bath could do with replacing as four of the tiles didnot match and the grout was missing from others,this was surpising for a deluxe plus room.Unfortuately we were awoken early in the morning by some toddler/child running continously around the room above ours.Although not the hotels fault but again perhaps small children could be put in rooms not above deluxe rooms.I would not have been to happy if i had paid full price.Breakfast was excellent,a great buffet too much to list but rolls,muffins,pastries,ham,cheese,cereal,full english,fresh fruit and all very tasty.Staff were quick to clear tables and attentive.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Booked on Hilton website at last minute. On arrival about 2 hours later, reception staff couldn't find reservation until they were shown the confirmation e-mail. My Hhonors profile has a non-smoking room preference but I was allocated a smoking room. Stale cigarette smell so strong that needed to have window fully open all night. Reservation also specified double king deluxe room but I was put in a rather shabby standard room with queen bed. When queried at checkout, the difference in rate was given as a refund. Temperature control on shower faulty so only tepid water available. Initially charged for newspaper even though none delivered. Good and reasonably priced dinner and acceptable breakfast. This, and friendly reception staff, saved overall rating being "terrible"
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.text: I stayed the night at the Basingstoke Hilton so I could attend an early meeting in town.
reviews.title: Budget Meeting

reviews.text: Rude, incapable, obnoxious bar staff. They can't make drinks. All we ordered on two separate occasions was tasteless. Super expensive but totally undrinkable. Staff has unhelpful arrogant attitude. Bar closes too early. They didn't even say they are closing and if we want another drink after sitting there for a while. Choice of drinks is minimal. Really expected world class hotel to have amazing drinks and attitude. Rooms great. Breakfast on the other hand again below average. Horrid overall experience.
reviews.title: Worst bar staff and drinks in history!!!

reviews.text: It was a fantastic hotel, we stayed for three nights to visit Legoland. The rooms were clean.The food was very good, children ate for free, and lovely inclusive full cooked buffet breakfast. The staff treated the children like a prince and a princess. Good value for money. 30 mins from Legoland and a Tesco in Basingstoke.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Checked in late on a last minute business booking @£89 for a double room. Lost my HHonors number on checking and tried to sell me getting membership - not a huge issue.
reviews.title: Not up to scratch - better off with an independent that pays attention to ther guests

reviews.text: Paper thin walls and windows didn't allow for much sleep (avoid room 220 - gutters leak noisily outside!)
reviews.title: very busy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room clean and fine although bathrooms are getting old.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: I was in England for business but I had the opportunity to go to various National Trust properties on the weekend and I decided to stay out of town rather than near the office.
reviews.title: Fawlty Towers

reviews.text: The property is badly in need of renovation/redecorating. The beds were hard and the television turned off spontaneously every 10 minutes which meant that I had to go through the Hilton splash screen when I restarted the television. The power went out while I was there and a member of staff showed up at my door with 4 tea lights in beer glass hurricane lamps at the time of my requested wake up call. He explanined that it was not a general power outage, it was just the hotel. On leaving the restaurant, I asked for tea in my travel mug. When I got to the car and took my first sip, the tea was barely tepid. The staff was trying hard but did not seem to have the tools to work with.
reviews.title: Needs Upgrade

reviews.text: Being staying here on and off ten years, whenever Audleys Wood is full. As a Hilton Honors gold card holder I stay in a number of Hilton. This is down there with the worst. Rooms are cold and amenities are poor with no fridge, no minibar, no concierge lounge etc. The bar area is also uninviting and no English ales on tap or bottle. Just frothed up nitro kegs. Breakfast is buffet and not so bad, although quality is no better than Premier Inn at twice price. Audleys is a far better choice.
reviews.title: Fantastic staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3 night stay for my nieces christening. The hotel is in a ideal location 5 mins from city centre. Rooms are nicely decorated and very clean. The staff were fantastic, very friendly and helpful. Room cleanliness was of a high standard. Fantastic value for money. Breakfast was lovely with a wide selection of food available. Would definitely stay at the Hilton Basingstoke again. Highly recommended
reviews.title: one night stay

reviews.text: we stayed at this hotel on the way back from a holiday and although this hotel looks like an over extended bungalow on the outside, it is very pleasant on the inside. Staff were very helpful. bedroom was comfortable and warm, Again hotel in the middle of nowhere, but town easy to get to bu taxi. ate in the town due to previous experiences in southampton branch. But breakfast good
reviews.title: Not what i expected from the"HILTON"

description: Modern hotel located 2 miles from Basingstoke station & 35 from Heathrow Airport.
